title: Character triples and relative defect zero characters
authors: Junwei Zhang, Lizhong Wang, Ping Jin
abstract:
Given a character triple $(G,N,\theta)$, which means that $G$ is a finite
group with $N \vartriangleleft G$ and $\theta\in{\rm Irr}(N)$ is $G$-invariant,
we introduce the notion of a $\pi$-quasi extension of $\theta$ to $G$ where
$\pi$ is the set of primes dividing the order of the cohomology element
$[\theta]_{G/N}\in H^2(G/N,\mathbb{C}^\times)$ associated with the character
triple, and then establish the uniqueness of such an extension in the
normalized case. As an application, we use the $\pi$-quasi extension of
$\theta$ to construct a bijection from the set of $\pi$-defect zero characters
of $G/N$ onto the set of relative $\pi$-defect zero characters of $G$ over
$\theta$. Our results generalize the related theorems of M. Murai and of G.
Navarro.
